text: Bottle shared at the Leighton tasting 08/06/2017. Many thanks to Paul for this one. A clear red plum coloured pour with a fine loose pink head. Aroma is nice tart raspberry yogurt, plum, cranberry, powdery. Flavour is composed of tart plummy fruits raspeberry, mixed red berries, . Palate is tart, medium bodied, super dry, airy carbonation. Nice yogurt funky-ness.

Red fruits, strawberries, red cherries, acidic, lemon, lime. Hazy red, tiny head. Medium sour. More sour red fruits, lemon, zesty lime, soft carbonation, medium bodied. Nice Berliner Weisse, great aroma. Bottle shared at Leightons - thanks to Scopey.
341ml bottle (thx, Louis-Phillipe B.!). Bottled on 2015-07-??. Pours a reddish pale amber with a white head. Aroma is cherries and sour notes. Same taste. Very nice and refreshing.

Poured a light cherry red color with aromas if light cherry juice, spur wheat, tart hay, and some musk. Flavors aromas the same with tart cherry juice and light wheat, some feint musk, decent beeline with fruit.

Draught at the brewery. Pours a hazy pink-red, with a large light pink head, which lasts well and leaves good lacing. The aroma has sour cherries and a little light wheat. Strong sour cherry up front leads into a little cleansing wheat in the mid-palate, with tart, sour cherries to finish it off. Super refreshing, and a very fun beer.
Pours a bright red with no head. Aroma of cherries and sour wheat. Taste is sour wheat, big cherry flavor, this is a sour cherry bomb. Absolutely amazing

Bottle. Light hazy red with a medium sized good lacing pink head with ok duration and regeneration. Cherries, yoghurt and raspberries in the nose. Flavour is bright with lots of raspberries and cherries. Some darker berries, very mild yoghurt and lemon. Soft carbonation and filling mouthfeel with some sweetness and pleasant sourness to match, although it gets slightly yoghurt lactic in the finish. Long finish with berries. Very enjoyable.

Bouteille de 341ml datant daoût 2015, donc vieillie 9 mois. Elle a su garder sa forme après tout ce temps, nous rappelant à lodeur un bonbon surette. Liquide dun rouge profond, avec une fine mousse rosée, elle négale pas sa sur à la framboise, mais elle se démarque dans le marché des Berliner Weisse au Québec.
Deep pink color. Big big cherries in the nose with modest tartness. Big tartness with big marachinno Cherry notes. Tart and refreshing. Excellent lingering cherry in the finish. Outstanding.

Bottle thanks to oldp0rt! Pours beautiul bright vibrant red with a finger of fizzy pink foam. Nose is massive cherry, juicy berry fruit, soft acidity and light vinous notes. Taste is cherry bomb, juicy fruit, light pie spice, soft wet grain, medium-low acidity. Finishes with soft tartness, lingering cherry, balanced sweetness, some cereal grain. Heavenly.

Deep pink with a good white head. Aroma is cherry, strawberry, candy. Light-medium bodied, sweet on the palate with a subtle underlying tartness. Taste is cherry pie, cherry candy, fresh cherries. Yum

A wonderfully refreshing sour wheat beer with cherries. A big fruity punch from the fresh cherries and the high carbonation. A solid sour presence blends well with the fruit and a touch of acidity. Very clean finish. Not cloying at all thanks to a solid tartness. The liquidy body suits the style. Does Dieu du Ciel make a bad beer?

Sample, 4-ounce, draught, during the Bières et saveurs, savoured on September 5 2015; eye: pinkish with an orangey hue, hazy, ring of white head, light lacing; nose: fruity, acidity, light caramel, light malt; mouth: fruity, acidity, light caramel, light malt, sourness from small berries, finale in cherry with presence of acidity, medium body, average carbonation, slick texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Échantillon, 4 onces, en fût, durant le Bières et saveurs, savourée le 5 septembre 2015; il : rosâtre avec une teinte orangée, voilée, anneau de mousse blanc, légère dentelle; nez : fruité, acidité, léger caramel, léger malt; bouche : fruité, acidité, léger caramel, aigreur de petits fruits, finale en cerise avec présence dacidité, corps moyen, carbonatation moyenne, texture coulante; en résumé : bien

Bottle... This beer rocks! Pours hazy and deeply red with a small, fleeting, pink head. I can only assume this smells like citric and lactic acids, grains and cherries, because I have a sinus infection. I cant smell anything today and its frustrating. Medium to full-bodied with tickling carbonation. The flavor is tart and fruity  so very nice. Tons of tart cherries and tannic cherry skins in both the flavor and the crisp, fruity finish. Another world-class beer brewed up by Jean-François Gravel! Best brewpub on the planet.

I dont rate berliners usually this high but man this one is exceptional. Poured a pinkish hue with ample head at the Shelton Fest in St. Pete. Aroma is BIG cherries and raspberries with a slight saltiness brine, tart wild yeasts, and acidity. The taste was delicious. Big fruit up front and center and then it transitions into the more tart and carbded finish. Fruit all the way (my two favs.) Moderate carb and tarness.

Pours a bright pinkish red with a thick, syrupy body and a pink white head a few fingers thick. The aroma is tart, fruity and acetic note underlying. Less tart tasting than the framboise. A light sweetness up front with a pinch of floral note, fresh, tart cherries and a finish of moderate sourness. A very easy sipping brew.

Bottle. Appearance is light pink with minimal white head. Aroma is barnyard funk, tart fruit, and light sourness. Taste is sea salt, cherries and light sourness/acid. Crisp dry finish, watery mouthfeel. Very refreshing, I like the rasberry version better but this is still really good!

Clear bright red colour, white head. Aroma of cherry, butter, buttermilk, hint of lemon. Sour flavour, cherries, cherry pips. Finish butter and cherry.
(from bottle @ THT: Hey Julien is back and Deans floor is moist tasting. Thanks for sharing, JulienHuxley!)
Bottle at THT tasting. Pink pour, no head. Aroma of butter, cherries and quite fruity. Flavor is quite sour, fruity and a bit thin. Refreshing.
Bottle @ Hey Julien is back and Deans floor is moist tasting. Clear red pink color, small off-white head. Smell and taste sour red fruit, cherries, brett-ish. Dry finish. Quite nice.

Bottle at THT. Clear light pink with soft very light pink head. Lactic, cherry jam, fruit jelly, sour grains, light herbal, some seawater. Over medium sour with very light sweetness and salt. Under medium bodied with fizzy carbonation.

Dégustée à multiples reprises, en fût comme en bouteille. Bière à la robe rouge claire et transparente coiffée dune mousse rosée éphémère et sans histoire. La bière est brassée avec une quantité de cerises telle que tout est profondément exagéré. Tant les arômes que les saveurs sont orientés sur une quantité phénoménale de noyaux de cerises et de pelure de cerises. Cest acide certes, mais au-delà de lacidité on sent une présence dérangeante de sucre, exactement comme un sirop à la cerise destiné à la confection dun dessert. Cest sirupeux, liquoreux même si lalcool est bien dissimulé et long en bouche. Finale de noyaux de cerises. Une fois par année me suffit amplement.

Bière rouge aux reflets quelque peu orangées, bien voilée, effervescence élevée, et surmontée dun col rose pas tellement large et moyennement dense, qui sestompe assez rapidement pour ne laisser que quelques traces à la surface du liquide. Arôme de pain frais, foin et grain, avec bonne dose de fruits rouges, des cerises certes, mais je trouve que ça sent surtout les fraises, et aussi un peu les framboises. On note également quelques effluves acidulés rappelant un peu le citron, mais aussi le yogourt nature. En fait, je trouve que cette bière sent le yogourt aux fraises, ou peut-être même les fraises à la crème, et ça fait franchement un peu artificiel. Nez tout de même bien agréable, bonne intensité, complexité moyenne. En bouche, pétillement moyen-faible sur la langue, breuvage plutôt mousseux, onctuosité moyenne au palais, on note un certain corps, une certaine rondeur. Au goût, cest très acide dès lentrée en bouche, à la limite du tolérable pour moi, cest très citronné. Lorsque cette acidité se dissipe un peu, on note quelques saveurs de foin et de fruits rouges. Tout comme au nez, je dirais que ça ne goûte pas nécessairement franchement les cerises, et que ça goûte même peut-être davantage les fraises. Acidité clairement dominante, bière peu sucrée, amertume inexistante. Complexité plutôt faible parce que trop déséquilibrée (trop acide!), et mis à part lentrée très acide, lintensité des saveurs reste plutôt moyenne. Même conclusion que sa consur aux framboises : correcte sans plus. Les Berliner Weisse ne sont pas des bières brassées pour moi

2015 version. 341ml Bottle from Halles St-Jean. Aroma: sour cherries and certo basically like a cherry tart. App: clear red pinkish, minimal off white pinkish head leaving a shy bubbly lacing. Taste and palate: light body,light sweetness, tingling feeling on the tongue, light to medium dry acidity finish. Overall: Prefer the raspberry version but this is still pretty good. A really refreshing Berliner Weisse. Guess I?ll need to buy more at my secret place.

Bottle shared by Frank, pours dark pink shade with the tiniest head. Notes of sour cherry laffy taffy, lactic wheat funk, pie and dried cranberry. Nice tart finish on a medium body. Still like the raspberry better but this is delicious.

Bottle at Ryans June 2015 tasting courtesy of frank. Pours a deep bright pinkish red with no head. Mouthfeel is sour with notes of tart cherries, sour cherry pie with the crust and beautiful sour fruit. Awesome.
Bottle. Bright almost neon pink red pour with a thin pinkish head. Aroma is so much cherry. Taste is also cherry with some tartness mixed in as well, not overly sweet though, more of a wheat base.

Bottle fra a trade, thanks maximet. Pour is deep red with a small off white head. Nose has tart cherries, funk and some cranberries. Nose is fairly acidic at first, lactic, tart cherries and cherry pits.

Robe rouge foncée, beau col de mousse rosé qui disparait rapidement pour ne laisser quun cerne autour du verre. Arômes de cerises rouge bien mûres accompagné dun sucre résiduel bien doux. En bouche, plus acidulé. Les saveurs de cerises sont juste bien dosées, pas trop sucrés et on ne tombe pas dans un style commercial qui ne goûte que le cool-aid. Le côté berliner weiss est plus dominant mais la touche de cerise en fait un liquide équilibré. La finale est plus surette avec des effluves de jeunes cerises. À boire encore et encore.
Bright pinkish red, big cherry aroma like fresh cherry nice. Tart sourness with rich juicy cherries, could drink this all day. Great

Bouteille 7 mois dage. Dans le verre elle est rouge vif comme un vin et elle est trouble. Seulement une petite dentelle qui reste forme le col de mousse. Sa sent les cerises cest le cas de le dire ! Wow un vrai bouquet de cerises mures et bien fraiches, tout sa adouci par le malt qui crée un bel equilibre.en.bouche leffervescence se reveille un peu et accompagne le.coté bien surette de la biere. Que cest rafraichissant! Le brasseur ne sen cache pas cest totalemnt dominé par les cerises et le coté sur, et on en demanderais pas plus! Le profil de flaveurs est simple mais tres satisfaisant car on a des flaveurs authentiques et de haute qualité. Sa rapporte car cette biere est une reussote sur toute la ligne.

Thank you Tommy for sharing. July,2014 batch. 

A - This color is out of this world. Just huge cherry. 

S - The nose is all cherry. Just loads and loads of cherry. Very fruity aroma, just a light tartness.

T - Taste is also a cherry bomb. Really incredible, sour cherry, melon, wheat base that leaves a lingering pilsener / kolsch mouthfeel. taste is incredible. I prefer the sharp sour of Framboise but this is a very close 2nd.

M - Oily but filling mouthfeel with a solid mouthfeel

O - Great beer overall. Need more.
Bottle, thanks Julien_Huxley! Ruby red color. 5.9%ABV. Cherry, cherry pits and marzipan in the aroma. Tart flavor with cherries, almonds and cherry pits. Not too sweet. Fruity, almost vinous. Nice!

Bottle thanks to GT. Pours a candy cherry red with average head, quickly dissipating. The nose is dry cherry, light acid, pomegranate, berry seeds. Richer palate, with tart cranberry, red berry spritz, light cherry liqueur. Solid, long time want.

[ Bottle ][ 341ml ][ MrChopin ][ Tasting ][ Tasting Snifter ][ 1.16.15 ]
>> Thank you Kevin for this treat! Solstice dété cerise. Pours a deep, clear, inky purple with pink foam. Nose is rhubarb pie, rich cherry pie, clafoutis, huge depth of cranberry and blackberry. Taste is rich cherry, high tartness, light lasting acid. Zippy, seedy, bright. No saltiness, soapiness, or slick milk dairy. No high citric enamel ripping acid either. Long acidic finish. Highly enjoyable.
Bottle, amber pour, white head, nose is cherry, taste is tart cherry, citrus, awesome brew, thanks GT2

Bottle - Sweet and tart cherry. Deep maroon and a thin white head. Very tart cherry notes, nice sweetness and a jammy cherry finish. Overall a lightly tart, but sweet beer that is exactly as described.

12 ounce bottle poured into a large wine glass. Pours a ruby red with a pink head of foam that fizzles out quickly. The arom has tart cherries, dry red wine, some wood. The taste is mildly acidic with more of a dry red wine taste than anything else. Dry and fruity cherry finish. Medium body and medium to high carbonation. Exceptional beer.

On tap @EurHop (Rome). Amazing cherry color, quite clear, with a medium head. Aroma of red sour fruits, lemon, oak, some cereals, very nice. Flavour is light acidic, cherry, lemon, dry in the end and a bit mineral, some astringency. Medium to light body, medium carbonation. Refreshing.

Bottle shared thanks to sleepydave ! Pours a vibrant cherry red with a finger of pink foam. Nose is seductively cherry, with some vinous complexity and juicy pie filling aromas. Palate follows with huge cherry presence and light grain backdrop. You could tell me this was straight black cherry juice and I probably wouldnt detect any alcohol and believe you. Smooth elegant and delicious !

Bottle @ THT December. Pours a clear deep purple beer with a very small, pinkish head on top. Aroma of cherries, red fruits, slight wood. Flavor is very tart, loads of fruits and cherries again. Slightly sticky, silky mouthfeel. Aftertaste is sour and long. Quite cool.

Bottle shared at the DOS tasting thanks to JulienHuxley. Pours deep purple with a rich pink purple head. Aroma of big fresh blackberries, raspberry and tart red berries. Flavour is light to moderate acidic. Medium bodied with light carbonation.

Bottle at the Dirty Old Sock Tasting, Den Haag, December 2014. Poured a clear red colour with some initial short-lived bubbles. The aroma is yeasty, cherry. The flavour is moderate sour with a smooth crisp refreshing, acid citrus palate. Moderate to light bodied with soft carbonation.

33cl bottle sampled @ December THT
No head. Beetroot coloured pour. Smooth sourness.
Poured medium purple with a small off white head. Aroma of tart raspberries. Light body, flavour is lightly fruity and sour, lightly salty.

341 ml bottle. Pours a hazy purplish red with a resilient, creamy pink head. Aroma is cherry, sour, wheat. Flavor is fruits, cherry. Finish is tart, sour, some lemon. Lingering tartness. Light to medium body, average carbonation. Somewhat lacking in complexity, but so refreshing.

[ Bottle ][ ½ of 34.1cl ][ Tasting ][ Trade ][ Tulip ][ 11.25.14 ]Dark ruby, puffy strawberry milk shake head. Medicinal oak-buttery nose, plenty of cherry sweetness. Heavy cherry pith and skin front palate, ultra dry across the gravel mid, tons of lactic acid softness in the thin, sticky body with light chardonnay oak butter in the lightly sweet cake-like finish. Very controlled, low sweetness, heavy but soft acidity, faintly watery. Tone down the oak and youre nearing New Glarus fruit territory. [ 11.25 Tasting Ranking ] 01. De Garde Cherry Raz Bu  4.202. De Garde Cherry Bu  3.803. Dieu du ciel dete aux cerise  3.504. De Garde Cran Bu  3.505. Allagash Nancy  3.506. Russian River Supplication  3.407. New Glarus Thumbprint Berliner  3.208. Sante Adairius Cask Cherry  3.009. Wicked Weed Black Angel  3.010. Cisco Cranberry Woods  3.011. Lost Abbery Veritas 014  2.712. Crooked Stave LBrett dCherry  2.513. Almanac Cerise Sour Blond  1.814. Firestone Walker Krieky Bones  1.7

12oz bottle from BD Camden during tap takeover. It pours a pale straw-orange color with a small white head. Aroma is acidic and citric, with notes of grains, hay, sour cherries and lemon juice. Taste is acidic with notes of lemon juice, sour cherries, hay, grass, custard. Finishes dry and acidic. Light bodied with lively carbonation. Overall, really enjoyable and tasty

Pour is dark ruby red, clear, with a small amount of dark pink head. Nose is incredibly strong cherry, very fleshy ripe cherry, and hint medicinal. Flavor is a bit more rounded cherry, light brett breaks up the cherry, no medicinal, cherry lingers through the finish. Medium to full body, well carbonated, very creamy feel.
Sour cherry, grape, berries, tart, hints of vanilla, dry finish. Not as impressive as the raspberry one but very tasty fruit beer still.
From a 33 cl bottle at the DC Pre-Turkey Day tasting on Nov 9, 2014. Pours a clear cranberry with a pink head. Flavors of cherry. Crisp tart finish.

Bottle shared at the DC Pre-Thanksgiving tasting. Thanks to MrChopin! Poured a clear ruby red color, pink fizzy head. Aroma was tart red berries with a bit of syrup sweetness. Flavor was nice tart cherries. Very Tasty.
Big cherry aroma and lots of yeastiness in this. Ruby red pour. Quite a sour finish. Soft carbonation. Lots of sour cherry in this. Bottle thanks to MrChopin.

12 oz bottle at the RateBeer DC Tasting shared by MrChopin, thanks Kevin! Clear crimson red color. Aromas of berries, tart fruit. Tastes of tart notes, berries, red wine. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Nice.

Bottle. Pours a clear ruby red body under a fizzy one finger pink tinged head that faded to a thin ring rather quickly. The nose is very heavy on the cherries, smells a bit like cough drops, the fruit is so intense. Just a light hint of tartness and cherry pit like almond note. The flavor is quite tart and fairly acidic though, super juicy and fruity with a very natural taste. The cherry in this is more intense than many Kriek Lambics, not sure how this is classified as a Berliner and not a Fruit beer. Nice lingering tart cherries and a gentle acidity. What an intense beer. Very enjoyable, but this is clearly a fruit beer.

Bottle courtesy of MrChopin, a huge thank you!! I was looking forward to this one most of all in this tasting. Beautiful bright ruby red color, off pink edge head. Nice full aroma of funky cherries, lemons, pineapple. Taste is softly sour cherries. very tasty.

Bottle. Pours clear ruby with a small, fizzy off-white head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is cherry, lactic acid and wheat malt. Flavor is lactic cherries, light malt and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a dark red with beautiful pinkish head. Aroma is mainly pungeant dark cherries, also lemon and soured wheat. Taste is once again cherries upfront. There is a lingering citric sourness and sweet concentrated cherries. Highly drinkable and rather simple/straightforward. I prefer this one to their more sour raspberry version.

Bottle thanks to Gikinjii. Pours holy candy apple red, large hot pink head that dissipates fairly slowly with decent lacing. Aroma is lots of tart cherry, lemon, sour wheat mash. Flavor is light plus tart, lots of cherry flavors (perhaps a bit artificial), some lemon. Lingering mouth puckering tartness. Medium-light body. Really nice.

Bottle as an extra from tom101010 , THNX man !!! 

Pours rather clear dark red, with a pink glow, head is rather small, dark pink and thick . 
Smell is Fleshy cherrys , swimpingpool-scent . Nice . 
Taste is intense . Enters a touch sour, little bit bitter, very intense cherry , very dry . The more you drink, the more dry it seems to become . 
Watery in the mouthfeel, but with great intense , natural taste . Very well done !
Bright red/pink. Nose is cherry, some oak. Taste is cherry, oak, very mild, crisp and refreshing. Prefer the framboises by a wide margin.

THANKS to tom10101 for this beauty! 341 ml. bottle at home. Pours this incredible dark, almost tad purple deep wine / cherry red, gorgeous with a sadly quickly gone very dark pink head. Reminds me a bit of Mikkeller SpontanCherryFrederiksdal visually. Just beautiful. Nose is gorgeous, deep yoghurt culture, light sour with huge amount of cherries, lots of juice. Taste unfortunately comes across a bit muted compared to the smell, lots of juice but mixed in with fair amount of cherry pits, leaves and a mineral / stone  like feeling to it all, yoghurt culture is faint here, tad dry. Body is all juice, dries out just like fruit skins. Heavy fruit profile almost begs comparison to a lambiek but that is unfair since it doesnt have the same depth; This is very straightforward, very drinkable as well. I could have wished for more but seeing as I have been less than enamoured with my resent brushes with the styles I can only applaud this. This is what I wish Berliners in general would taste like. In the end despite my nitpicking this is a thing of beauty, tart superbly drinkable juice with all the right cultures and not the off-putting ones as some Berliners seem to have for me. Bottled on 07/2014.

30th September 2014Craft Clerkenwell. Bottle tasting. Thanks to Paul for this one. Almost clear pink tinted red beer, small but bright pink head. Palate is light, mildly crisp and semi dry. Nice cherry, not too sour and just a little tart, Whisper of marzipan. Trace of tangy lemon. Light crisp finish. Decent.

Bottle shared thanks to Bropey, CBC Clerko, 30/09/14.
Cherry red with a decent crimson covering.
Nose is cherry drops, puff of smoke, straw, red berry sherbets.
Taste comprises light acidic notes, tanfy cherry skins, more cherry drop sweetness, spice, light woody rinse.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, tangy cherry wash in the close.
Decent Linner.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
341ml bottle from William J. Walter.
Pour opaque red with a pink foam head and some light traces of lacing. Aroma of intense cherry with light tart notes. 
Medium body, Sugary and light sure note.
Amazing autumn beer next to a fire pit and a thick blanket. Its 10 celsius at night in october around here.

Ruby red body with a thin off white head and spotty lacing. Assertive sour cheries, light earth, raspberry-like candy finish. Light bodied with smooth carbonation, bright acidity with slight puckering, semi-dry throughout, super clean finish. A bit one-dimensional, but thoroughly tasty.

Spina @ Eurhop 2014.
Rossa con schiuma evanescente 
Appena acidula, ciliegia dominante.
Non convince del tutto dopo una vagonata dacidi di Cantillon.

At Eurhop festival in Rome-Italy. Pours clear fluorescent red-rose with a small white head. Nose of macerated cherries, cellar. Grain in the mouth, dry and with a predominant cherries feel. Cool. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle shared with Richthevillan. Beet root coloured beer with pink medium head. Aroma of cherry drops. Taste is cherry drops, a touch of sourness and sherbet. Good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle picked up at BrewDog Clapham. It pours crazy bright red with a medium pink head. The nose is earthy, barnyard, mild sweetness, cherry, berry skin and candy cane. The taste is crisp, tart, dry, juicy cherry, sherbet, almond, marzipan undertones and light mouth-pucker with a dry finish. Light-medium body and moderate carbonation. Simple, tart and easy-going. Super drinkable stuff.

Tasting at Matts; 5.9% ABVBright blood and ruby color with pinkish color. Very nice aroma, lively, some cherry, but the mild acidity creates a berry impression. Dry, tart, light cherry flavor, but weak; light final astringency.Simpler than expected; very nice aroma, but lacking in flavor.

Bottle shared in London - many thanks to Paul. Pours clear, bright pink with a frothy red head. Lovely aroma with pitty cherries, grape skin, hints of wood. Light sweet flavor with tart, quenching cherries, moderate acidity, some grass, salt. Light bodied with average, sprtzy carbonation. Refreshing finish with more tart cherries, mild tannins, slight bitter grass. Lovely stuff. Supremely drinkable.
Bottle from Brewdog Birmingham; vimto purple pour with a thin pink head, tart cherry aroma, taste has light sourness, drying, sour cherries, wood.

Bright red pour with a pink head. Aroma of cherries, tart lemon, wheat. Actually well balanced, with the sweet berry flavours complimenting rather than overpowering the lemon tartness of the Berliner. Not overly acidic.

Bottle: Poured a deep red color Berliner with a bright pink foamy head with good retention and some light traces of lacing. Aroma of intense cherry notes with light tart notes clearly noticeable. Taste is a perfect balance between some intense cherry notes with almost no residual sugar and tart notes with almost no acidity detectable. Body is full for style with perfect carbonation. So good and I should have bought a ton more of these.

11.5 oz bottle courtesy of Raphael, served in a branded stem glass. Pours clear pinkish red with a small pink head that fades quickly to a few bubbles. The nose has big notes of cherry, tart fruit, berries, wheat, subtle hops and lactate. The flavour is moderately tart with big cherry notes, lactic acid, wheat and subtle hops. The finish is moderate in length, tart and fruity. On the palate it is light-medium in body with a watery texture and almost no carbonation. Overall a nice sour wheat ale with big cherry notes. 2014-09-14

Another great Berliner by DDC. Thanks Dominic. Pours a deep red with pinkish red head. This smells like a piece of cherry pie. Awesome. Very sour cherry flavors, cherry yogurt, lemon, raspberry. Tart cherry throughout. So good.
Dégustée au Festibière de Chambly. Couleur rouge vin. Arômes de cerises sûres et de blé. Même chose pour les saveurs. Moins Sûre que celle aux framboises. Très bon!
Pours bright red with thin but dense red head. Aroma of berliner yeast and cherries. Taste is very sour with cherries shining through. Sour aftertaste.

Bouteille 341ml. Couleur rouge sang foncé translucide, mousse rose foncée évanescente. Arôme de cerises aigrelettes, léger côté boisé, un peu terreux, le nez rappelle étrangement une Kriek. Goût de cerises, bonne acidité mais moins intense que la version aux framboises. confiture de cerises, framboises, touche de blé. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen-faible.

Rouge! Mosse rose qui tient en place un certain temps avant de se résorber en un mince voile. Des traces imprègnent le verre à certains endroits. Il y a en effet des arômes de cerises. Cest aussi fruité par autre chose, mais par quoi?! Peut-être du citron. Cest floral,mais très faiblement. Cest aussi légèrement herbacé. Bref, ça sent pas fort...On goûte la bonne bière acidulée, avec des saveurs plutôt citronnées. Le concentré de cerises, du moins, ça y ressemble, est bien présent. Ça engourdit un peu la bouche. Cest suret et ce, agréablement. Embouteillée 07-14 Lot 01 (1197-190814)

Blood red, very little head. Strong sour cherry aroma. Taste - sour cherry, lively body, tons of acidity. Very sweet - a tad too much for my liking. Tart. Quenching. Lots to like here, I just wish the =intense cherry sweetness was dialed down a bit. Thanks for the bottle Colin!
sample at Festbiere in Quebec City, beautiful looking red/pink pour, tart cherries, somewhat acidic but more fruity than mose berliners. either way a delicious beer

(On tap at the DDC tap takeover @ barVolo, Aug 23 2014) Pours a gamay noir colour with a small dark pink head and no lace, gorgeous. Aroma is of a yogurt with sweet cherries. Flavour sour and lactic cherry at first, then sweet cherry pie filling appears in the middle before fading back to the acidic side. Moderately sour. No grain, lingering cherry on the finish. Moderate mouthfeel, light tingling carb. Maybe this isnt the most complex beer but the fruit flavour is nicely concentrated and the sour Berliner character perfectly balanced against it. Malts are surely there to provide the body but their character never overtakes the fruit and bugs. A wonderful beer to drink, wish there had not been so much to try as Id love to relish a full glass on the patio.

Couleur rouge légèrement foncé avec peu de mousse. Au nez on détecte le fruit rouge suri. En bouche cest bien balancé la cerise ressort beaucoup avec beaucoup dacidité. Moins surette que la Solstice dété au Frambroise, on détecte aussi bien le gout du fruit parcontre. Très interessante aussi!

Tap at Bar Volo. Beautiful deep cherry red coloured pour with a neon pink coloured head. The nose is great - just loaded with tart cherry juice and a nice spiciness. There is a touch of cherry pit almond character and some nice fruity freshness. Really bright and thirst quenching with a soft tartness on the back. Fruity and delicious.

Bottle, pours a pinkish ruby red with a small pink head. Aroma brings out heaps of potent tart cherries, wheat, and a little funk  this is a cherry bomb. Flavour is quite potent on the fruit as well, with lightly tart cherries, wheat, and a very small touch of funk. Hugely cherry-dominated. Doesnt strike me as a Berliner, but this is exquisite nonetheless. Excellent stuff, but I do prefer the framboise.

Draught @ BarVolo Dieu du Ciel tap take-over.
Looks and tastes like a nice dry cassis. Clear and refreshing, with pleasant sour.

Bottle served in a duvel glass. A deep red with a pinkish white head. A wonderfully sweet cherry tart aroma. Medium bodied with a slick viscous mouthfeel. The taste is very tart and sour earthy cherries.  A really good tart cherry summer beer. Hmm how many times did I say tart cherry again? Anyways, I really enjoyed this beer.

Bottle 2014. Vibrant, clear ruby red with a dark rose creamy head that fades to pretty much nothing (initially one of the prettiest pours). A nice amount of fresh and pits of cherries. tart, acidic. Lots of cherry on the palate, low carbonation, mild yet strongly tart body, quite dry, complexity develops slightly on the palate as everything dries out. Quite refreshing and tasty.

Bottle (341 ml). Dark reddish purple with a medium pink head and some lacing. Aroma is of cherries, light sweetness from the fruit and light tartness. Taste is dominated by cherry puree with a light sweetness presence, nice tartness and a refreshing acidity from the wheat. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Light lingering tartness in the finish. As good as the raspberry version. Fruit forward, but it complete the wheat acidity very well. Quite tasty and mightily drinkable. Lovely.

Theres not much to this beer that isnt in the description. Its sour and tastes like cherries. The balance thereof is tilted more towards the sour end, but theres just enough sweetness from the cherries to make this enjoyably tart, instead of painfully so, and the carbonation is deliciously fizzy/bubbly. My only qualm....I kind of feel like the notion of flavouring sour malts with sweet fruit inadvertently paved the way for crappy wine coolers and Bacardi breezers, kind of like how the Immigrant Song accidentally paved the wave for Norwegian death metal, but I digress. In the end, this beer is delicious, made from real things, and its an interesting diversion from my usual beer habits. Definitely worth a try.

Pours a nice black cherry with a medium pink head that leaves some lacing. Said pink head dissipate quite readily into a small rim. Nose is of pure schaerbeek cherries and thats about it. Still, mighty fine and meeting my expectations. Taste is lightly sweet amidst all the fruit acidity and feels like pure cherry juice, really. It isnt over the top and really pleasing. Body is light to medium, carbonation soft. Overall this was almost on par with the raspberry version. My only thought is that the fruits completely obliterate the base berliner, can I get it straight please?

Merveilleuse bière rubis, voilée, coiffée dune mousse rosée. Le nez est presque surette tellement lappréhension est forte. Les cerises ressortent aussi, évidemment. En bouche, lacidité domine dès lentrée. Puis elle nous enrobe la langue, comme ces petites cerises sauvages qui nous rendent les papilles toutes pâteuses. Puis la cerise se dévoile subtilement en finale (mais il faut le savoir; on maurait dit que cétait des canneberges que jy aurais cru). Très bon, très rafraîchissant, très estival, très dur à trouver sur le marché ;)

Couleur rouge foncé avec une belle mousse rose. Arôme de fruits qui explosent...ça sent le surette mais ne lest pas. En bouche, acidité du fruit, notes de cerises, lentrée en bouche goûte la Kriek, beau petit pétillant. Acidité, amertume, maltage exemplaire. Acidulé et fruitée. Cest un produit qui peut se conserver, fait vite vos reserves.

Bottle 341ml.
Pours pink/red with low-medium dark pink head (diminishing). Aroma is of cherries, fruits, sugar. Taste is of cherries, sourness, acidity, red fruits, tart, grapes. Palate: Light-medium body. Medium carbonation. Good balance. Overall: Pretty good. More reasonnable than raspberries version (wich is a tad too sour for me). Cherries balance well.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2015 341 ml bottle this is for the 2015 batch bought @ local iga grocery a: bready, cherry app: clear dark pink border orange minimal white head. T/p: thin body with moderate long acidic finish. Nice texture not as velvety as next year edition. O: pretty good I enjoyed this year edition even more

341ml bottle. Clear deep red with a foamy bright pink head. Flavors are wheat, tart cherries and lemon juice with sweet notes. Moderate acidity. Light to medium body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

En bouteille 341 ml. Couleur rouge foncé, claire, mousse rose. Arôme de fruits qui explosent...ça sent le surette. En bouche, acidité du fruit, notes de cerises, lentrée en bouche goûte la Kriek, beau petit pétillant. Acidité, amertume, maltage exemplaire. Acidulé et fruitée. Excellente.

Un nez discret de jus de cerises un peu acide/vin. En bouche, on goûte un jus de cerises juste assez acide et sucré. La finale est semblable a celle d'un vin fruité. Excellent pour l'été 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rouge écarlate et légèrement voilée, une mousse toute aussi rouge, mais assez mince, se pose sur la robe éclatante. On dirait que je mapprête à boire une liqueur Maxi aux fraises, comme dans mon jeune temps. Au nez, les cerises sont présentes, mais ne sont pas tant explosives; elles partagent la scène avec les céréales également. Très similaire à la version à la framboise en bouche, bien acide et surette et très rafraîchissante. Mis à part le goût de cerises, la seule différence avec la version framboise est que celle-ci est un peu plus mince. La finale est toute en céréales. Délicieuse.

WOW, cest vraiment délicieux. Moins surette que la Soltice dété aux
framboises, goût intense de cerises. Un autre chef doeuvre de Dieu du ciel.

Smells great, deep sour cherry aroma with extra sour/tart notes. All fruit and acid in the nose. Beautiful appearance too, ruby red and effervescent, with a quickly fading head however. Tastes great, upfront tart cherry and sweetness, finishes with a more malty and acetic note. Light bodied and average carbonation. Could be slightly more tart for my taste, but great tasting nonetheless.

Pours mostly clear ruby with no head or lacing. Nose is tart cherries. Flavours are sour candy, sour cherries, some Vicks cough drops. Taste medium sweet medium sour. Medium body, somewhat sticky with light carbonation.

Bottle. Aroma is potent sourness with potent cherry that is fresh. Slightly hazy red under a pinkish white ring. Clean lactic sourness with faintly sweet raspberry and very low to no bitterness. Very dry and high carbonation. Clean.
On tap at brewpub. Ruby colour. Slightly tart, with a nice backbone of subtle cherry flavour. Enjoyable.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a bright cherry red. Aroma of table sugar and cherry pie. Flavor is sweet cherry pie complemented by tart cherry skins. More sweet than tart overall but very much cherry. Not a berliner weisse by any stretch, but thats ratebeer. Dieu du Ciel doesnt consider this one, and with god reason. Good in its own right.

En fût à la brasserie. Rosé/rouge. 6.7%. Belle acidité. Très fruité. Cerise. Canneberge. Griotte mais aussi cerise du Québec. Terreuse. Blé. Malté. Florale. Levure Sauvage. Un peu plus sucré que ses cousine. Pas mauvaise mais je préfère nettement la framboise.

Dégustée en fût sur place sur Laurier. De couleur rosée et légèrement voilée. Nez de levures fruitée (cerises sucrées et cerises sûres), léger de blé sûr avec des notes de sucre bonbon (genre cerise marasquin). Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-fort et une texture aux notes sirupeuses fruitées. Goût assez sûr (avec un caractère acide également) de fruits (cerises sûres avec un léger goût plus sucré  de cerises mûres) avec des notes de levures lors de lentrée en bouche qui devient progressivement plus sucré (léger de cerises marasquin) et le tout sur fond de blé sûr. Post-goût long-moyen et asséchant, composé dun moyen goût de blé sûr avec une légère aigreur fruitée (cerises sûres). (2006)

On tap at the brewpub. Citric, wheat, and cherry acid aroma. Theres a smidge of Berliner Weisse left behind, and I dont care, because some ass kicking cherry alcohol flavors remain. Bright fresh pie cherries played against that wonderful lactic acid base. Good cherry flavors like this come in so few beers, so Im so pleased and happy to enjoy it in a base style like this. The acids never too strong, the cherry somewhat balanced against the wheat, really flavorful and beautifully drinkable beer.
On draft at the brew pub.  Light reddish color with almost no white head.  Pleasantly tart and smooth.   Very refreshing!
On tap at DDC. gently hazed amber. White frothy cap reducing to a solid, thin coating. Aroma of barn funk, earth, tart cherries. Taste is tart cherries, earth, medium-high carbonation. Dry finish.

[3993-20110924] Tap. Strong fresh cherry pie filling. Hazy, pink orange body with a quick foamy light pink head. Cherry paste flavour is tart and thick and cloying. Medium-full body. Very cherry, very very cherry. (8+/3/6/3/14) 3.4
(DDC Tap Takeover @ Volo, Toronto, ON)

on tap at brewpub. pour is clear pink with a nice white head, retention, some lacing. nose is acidic red fruit, leafiness. taste is tart red fruit, light wheat and malts. fizzy, light body, quenching.

On tap at Bar Volo DDC tap takeover, this is the cherry version. The cherry comes through like cherry kriek. Its acidic, it gives off a big cherry (natural and artificial) aroma.Whatever wheat is in the secondary. A little lemon tartness as well. Very good and unique, but only drinkable in modest amounts at a time.

On tap @ Volo. Appearance: Cloudy pink with a small white head. Aroma: sour, cherry, mild fruit, yeast and lactose. Flavour: Slightly bitter with a fruity cherry finish, a little banana and a slight yeasty finish. Okay 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2012 Très fruité en arôme, sûr. Couleur rose vif avec une tête rose délavé. Au goût les cerises se dévoilent bien, jy retrouve également  les framboises pas encore mûres. Extrêmement sûr de la langue jusquau fond du palais avec un fini très sec.

Un verre sur place. Version à 6,0%. Belle bière rouge avec une bonne couche de mousse rosée. Le nez est parfait avec des arômes et effluves acide, une touche sulfurique et un peu de funk. Lacidité de fruit fermenté est très agréable. En bouche cette bière se révèle comme étant un parfait thirst quencher, une bière dété sans égal. Lacidité fait saliver. Une bière rafraichissante. 8/10

(Un verre sur place)  Le liquide a une robe rosée légèrement embrouillée.  La tête mousseuse est belle et solide.  Une dentelle décore le verre.  Le nez est sans surprise : il est fait de cerises aigres-douces et de blé suret.  Les saveurs sont agréables, fraîches gentilles, astringentes et asséchantes de fruits et de blé.  En bouche, le corps est moyen avec un bon apport de bulles et une texture légère.  La finale est surette, moyennement intense et assez longue.
Draft @ Blind Tiger. Ruby pour with tan lacing head. Light cherry tartness, herbal and spice tones, and wheat aroma. Flavor is of tart cherries, lacto, a bit of wheat and spice. Different.

Draft.  Pours a reddish amber body with a hint of pink lacing.  Cherry notes, sour wheat tones, a bit of cherry pit and skins.  A bit tart with a hint of lactic acid.  A spicy herbal tones, lavender, pepper, and a bit herbal.  NIce.

On tap at the Blind Tiger.  Pours a beautiful ruby grapefruit juice color with a big soft pink head.  Faint sour cherries and wheat on the nose.  Cherry, a bit tart but not super acidic.  Lovely, very different from most sours, gentle and subtle, very delicate.  Tangy cherry on the finish, light tart wheat and a lingering tang.

Tap at BT.  Pours a nice bright ruby red with almsot a bright violet tinge on the edge- thinning head dissipates.  Aroma is sharp fresh sour cherries, light phenolic kick, slight sour wheat note- with lacto, fairly clean overall- restrained, some light funky hints, tar, cherry pit, light prickly feel on the smell as well.  Flavor is fresh sour cherry- restrained with some slight phenolic plasticy kick, light grass, moslty juicy cherry, but lacto influenced- sour wheat hints, tart cherry pie, some flower hints- hibiscus, waxy lotus.  Good nice bracing sour tartness in the end- gets mostly lactic acid- perhaps some tartaric, but Im glad there was no aceto no matter how hard I tried to find it.  Good stuff- not a berliner weisse, not a lambic, kinda unique actually.  Nice!

Tap at the Blind Tiger. Lovely tartness wheat; the cherry prominent yet controlled,  very herbal and ripe.  Body is wonderful,  puckering, rich, very herbal and pure and delicious.  Almost salty, in a way, just an awesome complexity in this one.
Tap at Blind Tiger. Poured a cherry red. Nose is peppery and spicy. Fairly sour with an edgy backbone. Tart, dry and refreshing.
Hazy pink-red with a thin head and good retention. Aroma is sour cherries, funky notes and chemical notes. Flavor is sour, acidic, cherries, sugar and wheat.

on tap at the brewpub. pours a deep red with a foamy pinkish head. aroma is dominated by sour cherries and wheat. the taste is where this beer blew me away. it is sour, very sour. the cherry really comes out. very dry and refreshing. lots of carbonation. this is an unbelievable beer. it is my favourite of the solstice dété, very unique.

Draught, 5.8% at the brewpub. Subtle cherry sauce aroma. Hazy deep red colour. Very small white head. The flavour is nicely citric, does not taste much of fruit, but is balanced well by it. Dry finish.
DDC PUB. Foggy red color, very little head. Fine carbonation, sassy tart aroma. Taste immediate hit of dry and tart cherry flavor, really decent.
Pours a deep clear red with practically no head. Lovely cherry aroma. Lightly sour taste with light sour cherry flavour. Thin highly carbonate body. Really well-balanced and tasty!

Verre de 12 oz, à la brasserie de Montréal. Arômes de blé cru et de cerises sûres. Robe rosée et légèrement trouble, petite mousse et effervescence assez faible. Relativement mince en bouche, les céréales sont bien développées (blé cru). On retrouve de belles notes fruitées de cerises, sans que celles-ci prennent le dessus sur les céréales. Finale lactique bien sûre. Rafraîchissant !

Renamed RIP Greg, in honor of Greg Noonan, recently deceased brewer at the Vermont Brewing Co. A pinkish red wheat ale with a thin white head. In aroma, a pleasant sour cherry, with light cherry Certs notes and butterscotch. In mouth, a nice light and refreshing ale, a bit of epsom salts, a perfect sumer quaffer. On tap at brewpub Oct. 31 2009.

Tap @ DDC. My Big winner of what turned out to be quite a night at DDC brewpub. Bright red pour with a head that fades into a pink-white ring. The aroma is so sour, filled with sweet candy-like cherry smells. Lactic-dry taste that makes your tongue curl under all the cherries. Fizzy carbonation on the palate contributes to the overall dry sensation the beer leaves in the mouth. I was getting flashbacks of 3 Fonteinen Oude Kriek while drinking this. Truly an awesome beer great to see a quebec brewery make such a good sour product.

On tap at DDC. Pours deep red with a medium creamy head. Really nice looking brew !! Nose is wheat, lactic, tart and cherryish. Taste is cherry and light tart. Quite lactic but not too much. Very dry and very tasty. Carbonation is small bubbles, quite fizzy. Hints of grain in the taste. Grainy finish. Very refreshing, awesome beer. Im truly grateful to be able to taste this style here in Montreal ! To me this one was better than the framboise. Cant wait for next summer !!!

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2014 Bottle on 08/06/14.  Had to erase my past negative comment.  Amazing clear deep red.  Not over-tart, very pleasant cherry flavor, slightly fizzy carbonation.  Easier on my wimpy stomach than the rasberry version.  Very good, at least...

Served on tap at Dieu du Ciel.  Impressive appearance; pours a hazy crimson color with a thin and frothy pinkish head.  Smells sharp, almost like a cold slice of cherry or rhubarb pie.  Taste is immediately quite astringent on the tongue, hints of cherry and rhubarb with prominent acidic tones.  Finishes very dry, almost puckering, but is nevertheless quite refreshing.  Really seems to get the salivary glands going after each sip.  A unique beer and not bad at all.

Rose red apperance with a thick redish head and very nice lacing.  Aroma: Cherries, rasberries and bubblelicious gum.  Flavor:  acid, sour, rhubarb and cherries.  Palate: medium body, lively carbonation, thick sour finish.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2010 In short: A nice sharp cherry beer.  Very refreshing and highly drinkable.
How: Tap at brewpub (summer 2008 batch)
The look: Clear light-red body topped by a short-lived pink head
In long: Nose is cherries (duh!) .  This one has a pure natural freshly picked cherries aroma, not maraschino cherries.  Taste is sharp, surprisingly very little cherry sourness, slightly acidic, dry, a little lemony, nice astringency.  Very refreshing beer.  As far as cherry beers go this one is probably the exact opposite of the New Glarus Belgian Red (the most well-known example of the style).  On one end you have the Belgian Red from New Glarus Wisconsin with its filling and sweet maraschino cherries character and on the other end youve got the Solstice d Été aux Cerises from Montreal with its sharp refreshing astringency fresh cherry flavour.  And in between the two youve got well Detroit.

On draft at the brewpub. Poured a rose red with a small pink head. Big aroma of wild cherries, grass and a nice splash of slight sour funkiness. Flavor on this medium bodied beauty is tart cherries with a slight bitter aftertaste. Very good indeed.

While I was drinking my first pint, I saw this beauty walk by several times.  She was intriguingly attractive in the light which came through the windows.  A wonderful stawberry body an attractive off-white to cherry head.  The aroma is sweet and tart with cherries.  Very tart on the tounge.  I should have had this one last!  Big blod flavors, strong lemon presence.  Bitterness is there, but well balanced.

Aroma is a good hit of cherry, clear pomegranite, tiny off-white head. Light flavour of cherry, some malt as well. Light bodied, sweet, refreshing. Pretty good. Perhaps the year of aging didnt do any favours to this one.

Sampled draught at DDC on August 26 in the company of tiggmtl, ClarkVV and Olivier_MTL; served in a tall weizen glass.  Looks awful purty sitting in the elegant glass, hazy deep pink-red with just a smidgeon of creamy lasting foam....really intense aroma, both sweet and tart cherries and more biscuity malt than I recall in other examples of the style.....on the tongue, tart throughout but never really sour, quite restrained actually which Id guess would bum some fans of the style out but makes it very quaffable indeed; very juicy with lots of real fresh-cherry character....smooth and easy drinking but not ultra complex; heavier on the malt in the body as well as the aromatics, this is a delight but have no idea if its really "true" to style, seems a bit heavy.  Still, another winner from DDC no question.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2006 Draught.  At Dieu du Ciel.  Aged 1.5 years in a cask, and as Olivier_mtl said, perhaps not really a beer to age that long ...  Poured hazy pink-red with a small white head.  Buttery-buttescotch aroma (diactyl?) initially, then some light grain and vague mildly sour cherry.  The taste was quite pleasing - sour cherries, woody acidity, sweet malt - nice, but should be FUNKY.  Slick, oily mouthfeel, decent carbonation, very light acidity, a slightly sour and sticky finish - not bad, sort of disappointing - I would love to try a fresh -brewed batch one day.
Robe rose voilée surmontée dune mousse rose. Arômes sûres de cerises et de blé. Saveurs acides de cerises, de blé et de citron.

Draught weizen glass at DdC, 8/26/06.Softly hazy, slightly cloudy, with not a bright, intense red, but more a tangerine-pink with some deeper red highlights in the middle.  Off-white head perched atop is initially foamy and about a finger in height, but quickly recedes to partial cover/ring, with light lacing in patches.Nutty and acidic, sort of like cherry flesh, but without any of the sweetness or juiciness.  Dry, for sure, with the signature sour mash tartness (I dont know if Id go as far as to call it sour in the nose).  Very wheaty, recalling the just-mentioned nuttiness, which also adds a bit of dryness itself, but perhaps dulls the aroma slightly.  As it breathes/warms, a bit more acidity comes from the cherries, quite a bit more pleasant and more lively, but overall it just never really establishes a hard lactic or cherry tartness/sourness.Right away you can feel the dryness.  Bone dry, but a strong nutty, blanding wheat-like sensation, smooths out the tartness.  Almost astringent-like cherry flavor is fleshy, dry, quite acidic.  Lactic notes are rather tame, getting lost, a bit, in the zesty, boisterous carbonation and fair amount of aqueous space it opens up.  Still, a true, authentic, lip-smacking cherry tartness is there, mostly on the finish and while it may disappoint a bit, in overall strength, it certainly is drinkable and flawless.  No alcohol noted.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2008 Rebu l’été dernier (08), en fut (20oz). Bourgogne un peu foncée, petit collet rosé. Arome de cerises frais, blé malté plaisant. Goût aussi sûrette que la version aux framboises, mais pas aussi savoureuse, peut-être que c’était aux milieu de la bach. En tout cas, c’était quand même bien buvable!

draught. a bright and magestic fluorescent red body with a small white-pink head. sweet cherry aroma with undertones of wheat. refreshing tart body with a kind of funky acidity left in your mouth. very dry finish. great stuff.

Aroma:Cherry ice cream...
Appearance:red,light pink head...
Flavor:sour fruit,very smal cherry flavor...
Ruby red appearance, small fine head. Medium sweet aroma of cherry. Initial strong sour flavours, followed by chewy mesh fruity cherry .Not bad at all. Good one.

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2011 2011-09-24. Dark pink-red body with a tiny head that fades. 3+ Sweet and sour cherry in the aroma. 7+ Flavour has a modest sourness throughout, sweet cherry has a candyish quality to it despite being real cherries (I assume). A bit of funk in the aftertaste grows as you go. 7+ Average to light bodied palate. Solid but the raspberry version is much more to my tastes. 7/3/7/3/13-14 On tap at Volo, Toronto
2005-09-XX. Ruby red body, small creamy pink head. Tart, mildly yeasty and fruity aroma. Predominance of cherries with underlying tart-sour quality. Quite fruity. Less intensely sour than I remember the raspberry being but less quenching at the same time. Sourness lingers in a way that is pleasant at times and less so  intermittently. Surprisingly quaffable. 7/4/7/3/14 On tap at the brewpub while moving to Halifax for grad school, Montreal

Impressive, vibrant red with a slick of froth that contrasts with its pearly white color.  It really does look like those alcopop nightmares...
Strong, fruity acidity that reminded of raspberry flavored vinegar or a dry rosé wine, it had a floral-like sweetness that didnt come out at all in the taste, sort of like eau-de-rose or those flowery essences they use to make some mediterranian desserts.
Whoh, this stuff is tang-tastic!  Lip-smacking, like pure, unsweetened cranberry juice.  May not be for everyone, but I seriously believe that its impossible to make a Beer more refreshing than this.  Light, wheaty body, and a dry mead aftertaste.  This stuff is kick ass.

Verre de dégustation de 4 oz. à la brasserie. Arôme: Odeur de fruits et de vinaigre de fruits. Apparence: Couleur rouge "jus de fruit". Aucun col. Aucune bulle. Large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de cerises sûres. Long arrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture huileuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Sensation de craie en arrière goût. (Rating #268)

Reddish hue, with a frothy red pinkish head, with a sour fruitiness nose of tart cherries, even an hint of tart raspberry, in an agressive acidity aroma follows through on a medium-bodied and sour cherry palate with a cherry tartness and sourness flavor leading to an agessive sour fruitiness finish.

Beautiful clouded pale ruby. Mostly lasting white 1cm cover, fully carbonated. Juicy, ripe fruit aroma, fleshy and lactic. Tart mouthfeel, though not as astringent as the raspberry one was. A most classy end of summer refresher, but not a personnal favorite. The carbonation was intense, but not as engaging and crisp, the wheat less like a cracker you want to chew on, with lesser leafy bitterness. More simple than an amourette and kinda diluted. Highly competent as a fruit beer and very easy to drink nonetheless.

Orange-cherry hue with moderate carbonation but no head. Big cider vinegar nose. Cherry peel flavor plus some more acetic acid. Tart and sticky. Not so good in my book, although I'm still trying to figure out this style. This was hands-down the least popular beer among the group at my table.
Red color, no head. Sour aroma of cherries. Sour flavor of cherries with a sweet finish. Slightly dry mouthfeel, light body. Very enjoyable and refreshing, I like it a lot.

Red body topped with a quick-fading pink bubbly head. Relatively weak cherry aroma typical from underaged beers. Taste is a bit aciditic and maybe oversweetened. Good and long sour/bitter final. I like sour fruitbeers and Berliner but I think that one could gain a lot by aging a little bit more and being served in an appropriate glass at DDC.

(#400) Sour cherry and a touch of vinegar in the aroma. Very red with thin, white head that diminishes to ring. Initial short burst of sweetness and cherries overwhelmed by one dimensional vinegar sourness. Flavour builds throughout the tasting. Body is light and quite still. Perhaps this one did not benefit from aging? On tap (aged one year).
Red body, pink head, cherry, wheat and lemon aroma.  Nice tartness, lemon notes, cherry pits.  The fruit isn't as present as in the rasberry one.  Some yeasty hints in the finish.  A very good beer.
Very intersting beer,hazy red like fresh squeezed cherry juice.aroma was a bit musty,with some sour/tart cherries and fruit character coming through. A bit acidic but very refreshing.
Cloudy red. Pink foam. Light sour cherry & musty leather on the nose. Light body. Very tart sour cherry flavour w/ some noticeable wheat. Dry, "puckering" finish. Quite lovely.
Crannberry juice in colour.  Aroma of faint cherries, cranberries, lots of citrus.  Flavour was sour, acidic, tart, sort of lambic like.  Finishes sour, light, and very refreshing.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2010 The latest 2010, 6,5% abv version, was simply world-class. Even more so than previous vintages, which were also world-class. Am I making sense? This is world-class, period.

Delectable cherries and subtle wheat are involved in a lovely, soul-mate interplay with an oily lemon juice...Sweet and sour cherries take all the room to display their multi-faceted wonders...Like all of their berliners, this feels ultra-fresh, packed with the life of hundreds of sweet and tart fruit...Sourness is subdued compared to  their vibrant Framboise, which is their best berliner weisse I think, but Dieu du Ciel is no doubt one of the best fruit brewers I have encountered...
